meanings.sent1: The collieshangie between the siblings could be heard throughout the house.

meanings.sent3: The collieshangie over who gets the last cookie was settled with a game of rock-paper-scissors.

meanings.definition: To engage in a noisy quarrel or commotion.
meanings.sent1: Please don't collieshangie in the library; people are trying to study.
meanings.sent2: The children began to collieshangie over whose turn it was to play with the toy.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always collieshangie when it's time to clean their room.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued to collieshangie without reaching any resolution.
meanings.sent5: The animals in the zoo started to collieshangie when the food arrived.
